examples: And the gap in your data is temporal.
They're using temporal cues.
This thing has a really really fine temporal resolution.
You lose the temporal connection between the things.
Frequent episodes of déjà vu can happen with temporal lobe epilepsy.

words.defineEn: draw out a discussion or process in order to gain time
words.defineVi: rút ra một cuộc thảo luận hoặc quy trình để đạt được thời gian
định trước hoặc xác định trước

words.defineEn: (theology) being determined in advance; especially the doctrine (usually associated with Calvin) that God has foreordained every event throughout eternity (including the final salvation of mankind)
words.defineVi: (thần học) được xác định trước; đặc biệt là học thuyết (thường gắn liền với Calvin) rằng Chúa đã định trước mọi sự kiện trong suốt cõi đời đời (bao gồm cả sự cứu rỗi cuối cùng của loài người)

words.defineEn: the lowest sail on the foremast of a square-rigged vessel
words.defineVi: cánh buồm thấp nhất trên cột buồm trước của một con tàu hình vuông

examples: As they say, a danger foreseen is half avoided.
Under the terms of the new national security law, experts now foresee a deep globalized.
These Taliban commanders foresee no compromise on the horizon.
Do I foresee that the category is going to go into decline anytime soon?
I didn't really foresee a problem paying it back at that time.

words.defineEn: the part of the seashore between the highwater mark and the low-water mark
words.defineVi: phần của bờ biển giữa mực nước cao và mực nước thấp

examples: It requires foresight.
We have limited foresight into the future.
They also display remarkable foresight, planning, and cognition.
In a moment of foresight, the man slices off his own hand with a sword to save his life.

And Steve Bannon, for all of his faults and, you know, different uniqueness, had the foresight to see this as an opportunity that allowed Donald Trump to not to have to play the standard Republican Party politics game.
words.defineEn: providence by virtue of planning prudently for the future
words.defineVi: quan phòng nhờ lập kế hoạch thận trọng cho tương lai

examples: Before they could explore any further, the Crimean War broke out and forestalled their archaeological ambitions for several years.
In Chile, the government is allowing citizens to draw down their pensions for a third time, which economists say is only forestalling a bigger disaster.
It's a winning argument in the hands of authoritarians who want to forestall any appeals for democratic change.
words.defineEn: keep from happening or arising; make impossible
words.defineVi: giữ cho không xảy ra hoặc phát sinh; làm cho không thể

examples: A barley seedling predicts a baby boy, while emmer foretells a girl.
Every night, Baldur had gruesome visions foretelling his own imminent death.
words.defineEn: make a prediction about; tell in advance
words.defineVi: đưa ra dự đoán về; nói trước

examples: But space isolation researchers definitely don’t want anything like that happening to their subjects, so these days there’s a lot more forethought and careful monitoring.
This kind of sensory mix up is involuntary, and it's experienced without forethought in a durable and consistent way.
I just, I didn't have the, you know, the forethought of bringing recorders and stuff, you know, I was just like yeah,
words.defineEn: judiciousness in avoiding harm or danger
words.defineVi: khôn ngoan trong việc tránh tổn hại hoặc nguy hiểm

examples: Having the ability to wear several hats can be a beneficial quality.
A study found that green tea could be beneficial.
We planted cardoon in our community garden to attract beneficial insects like butterflies.
The two rival companies decided to put their differences aside and play ball to develop a mutually beneficial partnership.
The business partners chose to compromise on certain terms to ensure a mutually beneficial agreement, acknowledging that better a lean peace than a fat victory.
words.defineVi: thúc đẩy hoặc tăng cường hạnh phúc

examples: He is its beneficiary.
Over the past decade or so, with respect to the exodus of California, markets like Phenix and Las Vegas and Reno and Salt Lake City have been big beneficiaries.
But astronauts aren’t the only beneficiaries.
You know, the consumer is ultimately the beneficiary, clearly.
And William Blair has called it the only clear beneficiary of the Covid-19 outbreak in our universe.
words.defineEn: the recipient of funds or other benefits
words.defineVi: người nhận tiền hoặc lợi ích khác

examples: The referee gave him the benefit of the doubt.
The changes benefit management but leave the workers out in the cold.
Only a minority of people exist on unemployment benefits alone.
My friend studied the nutritional benefits of different legumes for her research project.
I prefer brown rice over white rice for its nutritional benefits.
words.defineEn: to be of use and advantage
words.defineVi: được sử dụng và lợi thế

examples: Despite its right-leaning user base a nd benefactors, Parler was not intended for just conservatives.
Their once-benefactor, the once-platform that was designed as an instrument to help Donald Trump get elected, now Trump’s turned against them.

MALCOLM BRABANT: The villagers acknowledge that the language is fading as fast as an Evia sunset, and they are trying to find a benefactor to fund lessons for young Greeks interested in perpetuating this unique sound of the mountains.
words.defineEn: a person who helps people or institutions (especially with financial help)
words.defineVi: một người giúp đỡ mọi người hoặc tổ chức (đặc biệt là với sự giúp đỡ về tài chính)

examples: And so, so, so that nice person I really appreciate that benediction.
words.defineEn: the act of praying for divine protection
words.defineVi: hành động cầu nguyện cho sự bảo vệ của thần thánh

examples: Are you some benevolent spirit of television?
Since she was in fact a benevolent white snake spirit in human form, their marriage had already weathered attacks by meddling monks.
The benevolent, shape-shifting dragons of China have the physical features of nine different creatures and look very different from the winged, fire-breathing dragons of Northern Europe.
Princess Savitri of the Madra Kingdom was as benevolent, brilliant, and bright as the Sun God she was named for.
This paternalism allowed masters to see themselves as benevolent and to contrast their family-oriented slavery with the cold, mercenary Capitalism of the free-labor North.
words.defineVi: hào phóng và tốt bụng; thể hiện lòng tốt
